intro: Trommsdorffia uniflora subsp. facchiniana, commonly known as the Sicilian bellflower, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Sicily. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
